greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest prime p such that -n is not a square mod p.
comment: a(n) is the smallest odd prime p such that Kronecker(-n,p) = -1.
formula: a(n) = 3 if and only if n == 1 (mod 3).
a(n) = 5 if and only if n == 2, 3, 8, 12 (mod 15).
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Jan 30 2019
